data.title: No build progress on Fort Lonestar
data.body:
On playtest 20151115.

In a game of 3, I was bottom left (top left was missing) there was no build status bar on my barracks. I could see everyone else's.

data.title: Add more building explosions to d2k and cnc
data.body:
Same as #9943 for the d2k and cnc mods.

I'm not sure though if all explosions are fitting (in cnc `big_napalm` looked a bit large).

data.title: Players get kicked from server upon game start when they have just downloaded the map being played.
data.body:
I didn't debug this in-depth, but I just came across [this code](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Network/UnitOrders.cs#L98-L107) and am pretty sure that the reason for the kicking is that the downloaded map doesn't get added to the `MapCache` properly.

data.title: Display user's IP-address on connect, nick change and disconnect
data.body:
I have noticed that someone is fakenicking me and joining my servers.

It is as of now not possible to find out who this is, and I'd love if you could see a user's IP-address in the console/log like this:

[2015-11-24T04:58:41] Baxxster (127.0.0.1) has joined the game.
[2015-11-24T04:58:42] Baxxster (127.0.0.1) is now known as King.
[2015-11-24T04:58:43] Baxxster (127.0.0.1) has disconnected.

P.S.: The map is "Blistering Sands" and can be found [here](http://cnc-comm.com/community/index.php?topic=2081.msg11697).

data.title: Add second exit to kennel
data.body:
Adds a second exit to the kennel. The AI loves to place these directly above other buildings completely blocking its infantry production.

The kennel exit and shp face south-west so it makes more sense that they can exit west as well as south. From a MP PoV, the logic is similar to the barracks change: #9967 (harder to block dog production with a single vehicle)

data.title: Unusable "grey ping" servers

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
These have been increasingly common over the last few releases.  We still don't know what triggers them, but we do know that restarting the server fixes them.

Clients can connect to the server and recieve the initial MOTD and map, but the ping then immediately switches to grey and players are kicked for "connection problems".

When connecting to one of these servers I see the following traffic: http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=jyWF8cAF

There are two things to notice here:
1.  128 orphaned ClientPing entries in the `SyncInfo` order (only the last one, for my client id 496, is valid).
2.  No `SyncClientPings` or `SyncLobbyClients` orders, which should have followed immediately after this if the server was working properly.

I strongly suspect that this was introduced by #5115, but don't have the time to investigate further.
Hopefully this is a good enough start to identify the trigger and kill this issue for good.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28553066-unusable-grey-ping-servers?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Made the HarvesterDockSequence class abstract
data.body: Will prevent silly developers like myself from instancing an unfinished base class

data.title: Implement suicide bomb for D2K Saboteur
data.body:
Another aspect of the original d2k balance (see [video](https://youtu.be/dmflM70vtZI?t=232)).
This introduces a yaml option for specifying what should happen when the demolisher enters its target:
- Temporary: Unit leaves again once it is done (existing behaviour).
- Suicide: Unit kills itself, increasing the kill and death counters of the owner (used for saboteur).
- Dispose: Unit is disposed without adjusting the kill/death count (engineer/spy behaviour).

I think it would be useful to take this on to prep since it is part of the overall d2k balance, so I have limited this pr to only change C4Demolition.  I have a [followup branch](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/other-enter-traits) for bleed that adds the same flexibility to Infiltrates and the repairing traits.

data.title: SpreadDamageWarhead impacts spread use ambiguity
Earned/min stats across all mods needs adjustment.
data.body:
Currently there's the 'Earned/min' and 'Earned this minute' in the Economy tab. I don't know how 'Earned/min' is calculated but I suspect it's done over a relatively long time-interval. If the economy of a player shifts somewhere past 10 minutes (often earlier), then for some reason it feels like the stat takes forever to catch up to reality, making comparisons of players' economy for this stat nonsensical in the late-game.

The 'Earned this minute' is accurate but it requires you to follow the numbers for a little while as it builds up and resets every minute. You don't want to wait for that. Perhaps if this instead showed 'Earned last minute' and only updated itself every minute then it would be something you would want to have a peak at from time to time.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28541475-earned-min-stats-across-all-mods-needs-adjustment?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Custom Map crash after about 6 seconds.
data.body:
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150919
on map 8d80c75134ed716442a3981934d30876646faf25 (Opperation Turtle V0.3 by OPPDelta).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.CellLayer`1.get_Item(CPos cell)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ResourceLayer.GetResource(CPos cell)

   at System.Linq.Enumerable.FirstOrDefault[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)

   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__3(TraitPair`1 x)

data.title: In D2K, harvester husks on a refinery are drawn under the refinery
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Destroy a harvester as it moves onto the refinery dock space.

Expected behaviour:

Husk is drawn over top of the refinery sprite.

Actual behaviour:

Husk is drawn under the refinery sprite.

data.title: Convert Missile RangeLimit from ticks to WDist
data.body:
In its current form, `RangeLimit` is not intuitive (when I read 'Range', I think of distance rather than time) and hard to get right on top of that (even more so now that missile speed can change during flight).

Converting it to WDist (defaulting to weapon range) would make the property name far less ambigous and the functionality much easier to control.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28521182-convert-missile-rangelimit-from-ticks-to-wdist?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Give Missile Tank weapon a range limit
data.body:
...and reduce Quad rocket range limit.

This should avoid/reduce missiles flying across the map.

For Next+1 we should consider converting `RangeLimit` from ticks to `WDist`, that would be more intuitive and easier to get right.

data.title: Recreate Saboteur cloaking ability
data.body:
In the original game the Saboteur had a bar that filled up. When full you could deploy the Saboteur to make it cloak. The bar would then unfill and once empty would decloak the infantry.

![saboteur](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/11326771/3f117408-916a-11e5-9547-60b653eed5a0.png)

data.title: D2k Deviator balance
data.body: This aims to make it more like the original, where it did some decent damage and could attack structures and infantry too. The deviation effect should only work on vehicles.

data.title: Rocketsoldier anti-air rockets unintentionally buffed
data.body:
Not sure when this happened (assuming the missile refactor). Comparing release-20150919 to playtest-20151114 gives me some different results.

Test case:

> Produce an `e3` and longbow or chinook
> Order `e3` to fire on the heli
> Keep moving heli around to evade missiles, while `e3` walks to catch up and shoot it

In release we can evade most missiles, in playtest we cannot.

data.title: Saboteurs should be consumed when demolishing structures
data.body: To match the original game.  We should implement this as a flag on `C4Demolition`, with similar flags on `Infiltrates` and `RepairsBuildings` so that modders can also make spys/engineers that aren't consumed.

data.title: Fix the description of ReturnToOrigin in Chronoshiftable.cs
data.body: Fixes what I missed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9982#discussion_r45465710.

data.title: Add an actor name overlay debug option
data.body:
Inspired by, and very similar to the screenshots on #8670.
Displays the actor type and ID over selected actors when enabled.

data.title: Fixes passability/buildability of several TD cliff tiles
data.body:
These definitely could not be moved/built on in the original (in fact, templates 29, 30, 31 and 43 have already been fixed before on desert tileset).

Note: There are a few more debatable cases that were of "Clear" terrain type in the original, but probably shouldn't have been (going by visuals/consistency), but I left those out for now.

data.title: Add a passability overlay to editor
data.body:
When selecting an actor to place, there should be a (semi-transparent) passability overlay that shows which tiles would be passable by this actor, so mappers won't accidentally place actors on impassable terrain.

Additionally, this could indirectly serve as debug tool for identifying and fixing tile passability issues as well (for example if a cliff tile that clearly shouldn't be passable by this actors shows up as passable).

Edit: It might be feasible to add this as toggleable option to dev mode as well.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28517248-add-a-passability-overlay-to-editor?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Multiple resource queues: YAML & Trait refactors
data.body:
This represents the first work towards refactoring to permit multiple resource queues. The first commit requires explicit specification of resource types on various traits which affected cash or resources previously, and the second commit lets a unit's value span across multiple resources.

One thing that's missing here is handling of text. Currently, for all text purposes, all resources are still just summed up and used.

I'm also unsure of the map upgrades. In particular, I'm unsure how the oramaps are affected and whether the upgrade code works correctly. The upgrade code seemed to fail on upgrading `^Templates`, but worked fine on regular units. Any comments/feedback would be appreciated!

data.title: Add SpiceSand to more terrain type definitions
data.body: Yep, there were some... basically needed to add the new terraintype to more places. If there any other's that might need it, please mention it.

data.title: GPS Inconsistency
data.body:
So I should probably use a image to make this easier to see but I'm too lazy to make one.

You know the little "house" marker you get from GPS to indicate a building? Then if you scout the area it shows the building but not the little marker. Well, say that player sells that building or some shit like that, then the GPS will just leave you seeing the building, however if it were the house marker, that would disappear.

How to put this?

GPS will show changes for buildings you have not actually scouted yet. However buildings that you have scouted won't show changes.
So its kinda inconsistent if you see what I'm saying?

Possible solution: Show house marker over known buildings.

data.title: Monster tank madness polish
data.body:
Few bit of polish for this mission.
1. Dr Demitri now uses a Russian accent - Fixes #10049
2. Prison / tech centre owner tooltip hidden
3. Add some mission fail checks for the ability to land on the beach

Remaining issues

-When LST is killed after the spen is destroyed and forces haven't landed at the beach, the mission does not fail - (need an efficient lua method of checking if a produced unit of type is killed - please recommend)
-3rd e1 reinforcement at start of mission stands still on the bridge unless the light tanks are ordered to keep moving (don't stop at rally point)

data.title: Fix worms not attacking anything anymore
data.body: Fixes a regression from #10007.
